title: PRESS DIGEST - Bulgaria - Oct 10
text:
SOFIA, Oct 10 (Reuters) - These are some of the main stories in Bulgarian newspapers on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Sofia's Court of Appeals said that the parole it granted to Australian murder convict Jock Palfreeman is immediately enforceable. Palfreeman, 32, was granted parole after serving 11 years of a 20-year sentence for the murder of student Andrei Monov in 2007 (24 Chasa, Trud, Monitor)

-- Six Bulgarian banks rank in the Top 100 of the largest financial institutions in Central and Eastern Europe (Trud, Monitor)

-- Volen Siderov, leader of the nationalist Attack party and a Sofia mayoral candidate, posted on Facebook that he awaits Angel Dzhambazki, a member of the European Parliament and the mayoral candidate of the nationalist VMRO party, for a physical duel "with all means" (24 Chasa, Trud, Monitor, Sega)
